properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 15 at 2:49AM PST until January 16 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Medford OR
properties.description:
* WHAT...Snow expected above 2000 feet. Total snow accumulations
of 5 to 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 65 mph.

* WHERE...Northern central Siskiyou County. This includes portions
of Interstate 5 north of the Shasta Valley toward Siskiyou
Summit. It also includes the city of Hilt.

* WHEN...From 4 PM Wednesday to 4 PM PST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Travel will become difficult. The hazardous conditions
could impact morning or evening travel.

* View the hazard area in detail at
https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/mfr/HAZARD
properties.instruction:
* Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination.

* Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and
limited visibilities.

* See http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions.

* A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow
will cause travel difficulties.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 4 PM PST THURSDAY ABOVE 2000 FEET
